name: Antimonium tartaricum

Abdomen: Pressure in abdomen, especially on stooping forward
Fever: Cold, clammy sweat, with great faintness
Stomach: Nausea produces fear; with pressure in precordial region, followed by headache with yawning and lachrymation and vomiting
Vomiting in any position, excepting lying on right side
Thirst for cold water, little and often, and desire for apples, fruits, and acids generally
Nausea, retching, and vomiting, especially after food, with deathly faintness and prostration
Modalities: Worse: in evening; from lying down at night; from warmth; in damp cold weather; from all sour things and milk
Better: from sitting erect; from eructation and expectoration
Urine: Last drops bloody with pain in bladder
Burning in urethra during and after urinating
Back: Sensation of heavy weight at the coccyx, dragging downward all the time
Slightest effort to move may cause retching and cold, clammy sweat
Face: Cold, blue, pale; covered with cold sweat
Incessant quivering of chin and lower jaw
Respiratory: Cough excited by eating, with pain in chest and larynx
Burning sensation in chest, which ascends to throat
Rapid, short, difficult breathing; seems as if he would suffocate; must sit up
Cough and dyspnoea better lying on right side -
Edema and impending paralysis of lungs
Much palpitation, with uncomfortable hot feeling
Great rattling of mucus, but very little is expectorated
Mouth: Tongue coated, pasty, thick white, with red edges
Red and dry, especially in the center
Skin: Pustular eruption, leaving a bluish-red mark
Sleep: Irresistible inclination to sleep with nearly all complaints

details: Mind and Head.Trembling of whole body, great prostration and faintness. Lumbago. Chills, contractures and muscular pains. Warts on glans penis.Has many symptoms in common with Antimonium Crudum, but also many peculiar to itself. Clinically, its therapeutic application has been confined largely to the treatment of respiratory diseases, RATTLING OF MUCUS WITH LITTLE EXPECTORATION has been a guiding symptom. There is much DROWSINESS, DEBILITY AND SWEAT characteristic of the drug, which group should always be more or less present, when the drug is prescribed. Gastric affections of drunkards and gouty subjects. CHOLERA MORBUS. Sensation of coldness in blood-vessels. BILHARZIASIS. Antimonium tart is homeopathic to dysuria, strangury, hematuria, albuminuria, catarrh of bladder and urethra, burning in rectum, bloody mucous stools, etc. Antimon tart acts indirectly on the parasites by stimulating the oxidizing action of the protective substance. By-effects following injection for Bilharziasis. CHILLS AND CONTRACTURES and pain in muscles.Vertigo alternates with drowsiness. Great despondency. Fear of being alone. Muttering, delirium, and stupor. Vertigo, with dullness and confusion. Band-like feeling over forehead. Face pale and sunken. Child will not be touched without whining. Headache as from a band compressing. (Nit-ac.)
Natural History: Tartar Emetic. Tartrate of Antimony and Potash
dosage: Second and sixth trituration. The lower potencies sometimes aggravate.
